title: Bauer and Seven lock in $40m PacMags deal
text:
Seven West Media and Bauer Media have sealed a $40 million deal for Pacific Magazines to create a publishing portfolio which will combine Better Homes & Gardens and New Idea with The Australian Women's Weekly and Gourmet Traveller.

The Australian Financial Review foreshadowed the pair would come to an agreement this morning after last week revealing the price tag the German publishing would pay Seven.

The deal remains subject to approval from the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission.

Bauer and Seven have struck a deal for Pacific Magazines. Louie Douvis

"The sale of Pacific Magazines is another major initiative aligned with our strategy to improve balance sheet flexibility and simplify the operating model to enable greater focus on growth initiatives," Seven chief executive James Warburton said.

"The team at Pacific have been at the forefront of our groups transformation and have done a tremendous job at repositioning their business, but there can be no doubt that there is a greater future within a larger scaled magazine group."
description: Seven West Media and Bauer Media seal a $40 million deal for Pacific Magazines bringing together some of the biggest magazine titles in the country.
